newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank, News Corp to sell all TV Asahi shares.
newsitem.headline: Softbank, News Corp to sell all TV Asahi shares.

text.p: Softbank Corp announced on Monday that it and News Corp have agreed to sell all of their shares in Asahi National Broadcasting Co (TV Asahi) to the Japanese network's affiliate, the mass-circulation Japanese daily Asahi Shimbun, for 41.75 billion yen.
Softbank and News Corp jointly bought 5,136 shares of TV Asahi for the same amount in June 1996.
Softbank also said in a statement that both TV Asahi and Asahi Shimbun, one of TV Asahi's biggest shareholders, will continue to support the JSkyB project planned by Softbank and News Corp in Japan.
Last year's purchase of TV Asahi shares by Softbank and News Corp surprised TV Asahi shareholders as the two firms acquired the shares through another company.

TV Asahi's shareholders had told Softbank that they would not accept board members from Softbank and News Corp unless they confirm in a written statement that they would refrain from purchasing more shares of TV Asahi.
TV Asahi, citing requests from other big shareholders, also asked Softbank and News Corp to confirm that they would not be involved in management of the company.

Softbank and News Corp had said that they were not interested in taking over TV Asahi and the share purchases were intended to help them acquire Japanese-language software for planned digital satellite broadcasts.
TV Asahi plans to list its shares on the Japanese stock market within a few years.
